intro: Leptosema daviesioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf leptosema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale yellow to white flowers, which are typically borne on short pedicels. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in open woodlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warmer climates.
